result.execSummary:
The defendant Savient Jamar Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: consecutive to any other sentence straight time.

miscConds.notes:
Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

Absolute sobriety with random testing.
No contact with BDW or JKC.
Participate in an anger management program.

timeConds.notes:
straight time.
Imposed and stayed for use by the PO agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Savient Jamar Owens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Savient Jamar Owens in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court made an oral amendment as to Count 1 modifier Use of a Dangerouse Weapon.  The correct modifier number is 939.63(1)(a).
Plea hearing proceeded.   Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 270 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence straight time.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 12 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- 30 days condition in the HOC straight time imposed and stayed for use by the PO agent.
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- participate in an anger management program
- no contact with BDW or JKC
- no possession of firearms
- 20 hours of community service

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

Appeal rights given
*
Court denied defense request for expungement

Defendant Savient Jamar Owens in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Savient Jamar Owens appeared by video means with Attorney.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Savient Jamar Owens in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Case recalled.  Defendant appeared.  Court ordered the bench warrant withdrawn.  Atty. Plummer requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BDW.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Savient Jamar Owens in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/22 @ 1p
